fields.description:
When JIRA (or Confluence it seems) sends out a trackback ping, it converts non-ASCII characters to ?'s.

To replicate, set up two JIRA Standalone (hsqldb) instances at http://localhost:8081/jira1 and http://localhost:8082/jira2. Make sure to correct their base URLs, and make the issues anonymously visible so pings are sent. Create an issue with a non-ASCII summary (I used Картинки from google.ru). Wait for the ping to appear in the linked issue. It appears as in the screenshot.

Capturing the ping POST with ethereal shows:


POST /jira1/rpc/trackback/TP-13 HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
User-Agent: Jakarta Commons-HttpClient/3.0-rc3
Host: localhost:8081
Content-Length: 272

url=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8082%2Fjira2%2Fbrowse%2FTP-16&title=%5BTP-16%5D+%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F&blog_name=JIRA%3A+Test+Project&excerpt=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8081%2Fjira1%2Fbrowse%2FTP-13+null
HTTP/1.1 200 OK

Those are definitely question marks:

python -c 'import urllib; print urllib.unquote("url=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8082%2Fjira2%2Fbrowse%2FTP-16&title=%5BTP-16%5D+%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F&blog_name=JIRA%3A+Test+Project&excerpt=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8081%2Fjira1%2Fbrowse%2FTP-13+null")'

url=http://localhost:8082/jira2/browse/TP-16&title=[TP-16]+????????????????????????????????&blog_name=JIRA:+Test+Project&excerpt=http://localhost:8081/jira1/browse/TP-13+null
fields.summary: Sent trackback pings mangle international characters

fields.description:
Currently the unit test entityengine.xml is using the DumbFactory transaction factory, which causes us to need to invoke the UtilsForTestSetup.loadDatabaseDriver() method. There are lots of JIRA classes that initialize the db without us really realizing it and the ordering of the running of the unit tests can make it such that the "test" db connection gets initialized incorrectly.

We need to change the test entityengine.xml to use the Jotm transaction factory. This will cause the TestUpgradeUtils test to fail because the upgrade util is written in such a way that it assumes the Connection is in autocommit mode. This test and the method it tests either needs to be removed or we need to update the code to check if the connection is set to autocommit and if not then commit the connection.
fields.summary: Fix the test entityengine.xml to use JotmFactory as the transaction factory and remove UtilsForTestSetup.loadDatabaseDriver(); from the unit tests

fields.description:
When viewing an issue from the issue navigator, the previous/next links are shown to navigate to respective issues.
To generate these, a search request is done.  This can cause long delays, esp. when there are a lot of results returned from the search.
fields.summary: Previous/next can cause long delays on view issue

fields.description:
It will be great to apply conditions to project tab panels plugins like for "Preset filters" and other web-items.

The main idea is to display project tabs depending on current project role.
(e.g. display Issue type-specific tabs for different roles: Requirements and Risks for Analyst, Test Cases and Defects for QA Team, etc.)
fields.summary: Add possibility to display project tab panel plugins conditionally

fields.description:
It's a great idea to move project filters, operations and menu items to plugins.
To be completely consistent it's worth moving Project summary and Open Issues in the "Browse Project" page to plugins as well.

It will allows to display custom statistic items, histograms, etc in this area.
fields.summary: Move "Project Summary" to plugins

fields.description:
Steps:
- Log in as *JIRA admin*
- Create user *test*
- Create project *TST* with project lead *test*
- Assign user to project role *Administrator*
- Log in as user *test*
- Go to Administration, select project *TST* and click *Edit Project*

Actual behavior: system redirects to login page
Expected: system displays edit project page
fields.summary: System redirects to Login page when Project Administrator clicks "Edit Project"

fields.description: I realize your calendar pop-up is a third party application, but I found today that it is setting the context for today's date based on the workstation instead of the system date in JIRA. Is it possiible to correct that? I noticed this because I was testing one of my apps while my workstation date was set to Jan 2007, and when I updated my JIRA issue to set the due date, it also thought today was Jan 2007.
fields.summary: Calendar popup uses local date

fields.description: I have a project with 58 issues for a particular version. If I click on the Roadmap link it shows all 58 issues. If I click on the version label it creates a filter for me for the project/version, showing the same 58 issues. However, if I choose a personal roadmap it displays only 16 issues, which I assume is the subset of those issues which are assigned to me. Now, if I click on the version label, again it creates a filter for me, but it has forgotten to add the filter of assigned to current user, so I get the same 58 issues rather than 16. this is confusing. As an aside, I couldn't find any explanation of personal roadmap in your documentation. As another aside, I did a search on your doc'n just for roadmap and it found nothing, even though I know that is listed somewhere!
fields.summary: Personal Roadmap creates incorrect filter

fields.description:
In Japan, it is common practise to set up encoding like this:

DB/HTML > UTF-8
EMail > iso-2022-jp (this is because a large number of Japanese users are still using older mail clients)

Currently, JIRA uses the same encoding setting throughout i.e. the encoding setting (webwork.i18n.encoding in webwork.properties) is shared among different components, e.g. MailSender, TemplateManager, etc. Therefore, in order to meet Japanese requirements, currently the only option is to manually modify the source code of the MailSender class, which obviously does not work for most of our customers.

Could you consider having the option setting in next release of JIRA to allow choosing a mail encoding setting different from the DB/html encoding setting?
fields.summary: Please allow ability to set mail encoding separtely from html/DB enoding

fields.description:
Request the ability to Hide the "Assign this Issue" function under "Operations". 

This forces the users to use the "Available workflow actions" and not assign an issue outside the workflow.

This is really causing a problem for our team especially since we have many new users.

For example, a ticket is in QA and a business user who reported it and watching it will assign it to a business person to sign off. It is still in a QA status and the business person cannot do anything with it as they have no Available Workflow actions.
fields.summary: Ability to Hide the "Assign this Issue" function under "Operations"

fields.description: I don't want our clients to be able to view the work done on issues but can't find an obvious way of preventing them from viewing this.
fields.summary: Hiding the Work Logged from 'Reporters' viewing their own issues.

fields.description:
Tomcat has directory listing enabled by default. This allows browsing directories (such as /images/). It seems that the filters do not take action in preventing the unauthorized access.

When directory listing is disabled (/conf/web.xml in Tomcat directory) Jira gives 404 errors.

See [JSP-8129|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-8129]
fields.summary: Directory listing enabled on Tomcat

fields.description:
The comments RSS feed looks at the Issue Search Request for any restrictions on the "updated" date. If there are any, the same restrictions are applied to comments created date.

For example, if a search request finds all open issues for version 3.7 updated after 20-Jun-2006, then the comments RSS feed will return comments that have been created after 20-Jun-2006 for issues that are open and are marked for version 20-Jun-2006.

Ifthe Issue Search request has no parameters for Updated date then all comments of issues that match the search request are returned in the RSS feed.

This functionality needs to be documented.
fields.summary: Need to document how to restrict recent comment RSS feed to only show comment after a certain date

fields.description:
Please check the *exact* syntax for the Orion datasource.

Also please check with Jeff if *OC4J* is similarly affected.

The pooled location needs to be used to ensure database transactions work in JIRA. See Jed or Dylan if you need more info.
fields.summary: Update docs for Orion and specify that pooled location should be used.

fields.description:
In the custom field, "Time since last comment" a really long duration shows as weeks not as years.

For example on CONF-819 at the moment, the field shows as "117 weeks, 2 days ago". It would be better written as "2 years, 13 weeks ago". 

Note that a year is not a whole number of weeks (and actually varies in length if you want to be precise).
fields.summary: Use 'years', not just 'weeks' in duration display

fields.description:
AFTER means that the date is included, for ex : Created After : 01/01/2006, means that all issues created after the 01/01/2006, 01/01/2006 included.
In French you have translated AFTER into APRES, APRES means date not included, you should translate with : "A partir de".

fields.description:
JIRA requires various directory paths to operate (search index path, attachment path, backup path). These are currently stored in the database. This is bad, because directories are specific to the server machine, not the data. Directory paths should be stored in the app server with all the other (non-portable) configuration data, rather than in the (portable) JIRA data.

For instance, it should be possible to set the JIRA index directory with a system property (-Djira.indexpath=/var/jira/indexes), or perhaps via a JNDI entry.
fields.summary: Allow directory paths (index, attachments, backup) to be specified in the app server

fields.description: The Enterprise inner class in APKeys class seems to be used no longer. We searched for usages of the class as well as text search matching APKeys.Enterprise but found nothing but selfreference. This class can be removed

fields.description: The favicon in jira/src/webapp/favicon.ico still has the old JIRA logo.  This should be replaced with the correct favicon in jira/src/webapp/images/icons/favicon.ico to make sure pages that don't explicitly set the icon (such as RSS views, unresolvable links like http://jira.atlassian.com/foo...) use the correct logo.
fields.summary: Replace the old favicon with the new JIRA logo in the webapp root

fields.description:
To re-produce:

1. Create Project A with an associated issue security scheme
2. Create an issue with a security level set and a sub-task
3. Create Project B with no associated issue security scheme
4. Move issue (with its sub-task) from Project A into Project B

*Results*
The issue is created in Project B but with no sub-tasks visible on the View Issue page nor the Issue Navigator even though the sub-tasks where created in the new project. This is due to the security levels being retained from Project A (as discussed at [JRA-10546|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10546])

Below are the parent issue and 2 sub-tasks created in Project B
{noformat}
mysql> select id, pkey, issuetype, security from jiraissue where project = '10011';
+-------+-------+-----------+----------+
| id    | pkey  | issuetype | security |
+-------+-------+-----------+----------+
| 10065 | BBB-1 | 4         |     NULL |
| 10066 | BBB-2 | 5         |    10001 |
| 10067 | BBB-3 | 5         |    10001 |
+-------+-------+-----------+----------+
{noformat}
where  *BBB-1* is the parent issue and *BBB-2* and *BBB-3* are its sub-tasks. If the security fields above are then updated to NULL for *BBB-2* and *BBB-3* the sub-tasks are then viewable.

Additionally, if the target project also has a security scheme associated to it the user is prompted to pick a security level to apply to the issue being moved in the *move wizard* and works correctly.
fields.summary: Moving a parent issue (with it's sub-tasks) that has a security level set into a project with no security scheme set makes the sub-tasks non-viewable in the new project due to retaining its original security level

fields.description:
Since JIAR 3.7 it is possible to add preset filters on the Browse Project page by creating a Web Fragment plugin.

It would be great if this was also possible just by using JIRA's UI.
fields.summary: Allow to create/modify/remove preset filters on the Browse Project page through the web interface.

fields.description:
As we have resolved JRA-10942 a lot of users will be interested in exactly how to create a new Web Fragment for a "preset filter".

The document should provide an example for a preset filter (e.g. adding a search that finds all issues in Closed status in a given project). The code from the example (more precisely the needed XML) should be added to the JIRA devkit.
fields.summary: Create a document that describes how to create a custom preset filter web fragment

fields.description:
Especially on the Atlassian JIRA (=this) system, issues are frequently created and later found duplicates of others.  (Happed so e.g. with CONF-6827 for me)

If a issue is resolved as duplicate, it could make sense to copy/merge the votes and watches of the resolved issue into the one which is "left open".
Otherwise, the votes are lost (at least until all the voters also vote for the "left open"-issue) and the watches are also more or less useless because no further changes will occur on the resolved issue.

Therefore I think it makes sense to merge/copy votes and watches.

The are possibly circumstances when it does not makes sense, so I propose to add "Merge Votes and Watches" as a option which is enabled by default but could be untagged/disabled.
From my perspective, the option should apply only if a issue is resolved as "duplicate".

Martin
fields.summary: Merge Votes and Watches when Issue is solved by declaring as duplicate

fields.description:
From JSP-7911, Jeff Turner [12/Nov/06 06:46 PM] said:

{quote}
Yes, to do it properly requires JIRA and Confluence to share authentication, or for the user to be able to define permission equivalencies. If you really need that, as opposed to what the [one-time token solution|JRA-6772] would provide, then please create a new feature request at http://jira.atlassian.com, describing your use-case.

Cheers,
Jeff
{quote}

The use case is that we'd like to have a project portal in Confluence that includes the results of a JIRA filter. The portal will be accessed by users with a variety of JIRA permission levels. It would be ideal if the JIRA portlet only displayed issues that the current user has permission to view. There are a variety of workarounds that partially address the scenario, but none that do it nicely. With Atlassian Crowd and SSO, I would think that it would be possible for JIRA and Crowd to transparently share authentication.
fields.summary: Share authentication with JIRA + Confluence + Crowd

fields.description:
My company uses JIRA to do issue tracking for software development projects. We use JIRA both internally (development process) and externally (customer testing). Often the Security Level of issues is set to 'None' when creating issues for the development process. After some time the customer needs te be given access to the JIRA project, at which point we need to correct the issue security level to hide some issues (for various reasons).

To edit the security level for closed issues, we have to reopen the issue, change the issue, resolve the issue and then close it again. When resolving the issue, the original resolution is lost if we do this in a bulk change (always).

So we really want to change the security level of (closed) issues without having to reopen them. A bulk change to set the security level of issues would solve this problem.
fields.summary: Change Issue Security for Closed Issues

fields.description:
The older IssueNavigator's RSS view allowed to set the maximum number of issues. It was used and now it is crucial for our application.

But the new RSS feeder seems to ignore this parameter. 

Here's the URL our application requests:
 http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?pid=10240&updated:previous=-7d18h59m&updated:next=-14h22m&view=rss&decorator=none&start=0&mode=hide&tempMax=100&reset=true&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC

It is being redirected to:

http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchreqest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?pid=10240&updated:previous=-7d18h59m&updated:next=-14h22m&view=rss&decorator=none&start=0&mode=hide&tempMax=100&reset=true&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC

The tempMax=100 parameter here is ignored; the result contains only 25 items. 

Please bring tempMax parameter back, or any similar simple way to set the issue number limit. 
Thanks!

fields.summary: NPE when requesting XML representation of an issue

fields.description:
It would be a useful feature to be able to set up a regular email to each user giving their list of current open issues; a nag email.

A possible way of doing this would be to have a service than ran regularly (e.g. once a week).  This service would trigger a custom event when it fired.  That custom event could be used to trigger email sending.  Currently it looks like the events can be triggered only on workflow transitions, which means that they require active input from somebody.

I'm aware that each user can set up a filter of their open issues and then subscribe to it; which allows them to get a regular nag email at whatever frequency they choose.  That's a good feature.  It is, however, voluntary; there's no way (that I know of) of forcing the user to have this subscription.  Also, it requires setting up an individual filter and subscription for each user.

If a timer service were available, it could potentially be useful for a number of other events as well as sending regular email.
fields.summary: Service to trigger a regular email reminder of open issues
